item.title: Paul Walker dead in a car crash
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Which part? I hate when religious people get sad when someone dies though. It’s almost proof they subconsciously don’t believe it for if they did they would rejoice. And us humans as a whole are quite selfish. /rant

Read full topic
item.source: Paul Walker dead in a car crash

item.title: Paul Walker dead in a car crash
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

The Wanderer:

People blow death out of proportion. Everyone dies eventually. Sure he was a loss to the world for what he did but many people like him will die and he wasn’t the first nor the last. No need to mourn or anything. And if you believe in an afterlife you should be rejoicing because he is in a better place now.

I don’t believe in that sheit.

Read full topic
item.source: Paul Walker dead in a car crash

item.title: Paul Walker dead in a car crash
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:29, topic:536285”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=655097.msg4386758#msg4386758 date=1385873817]
rip the other 100,000 people that die each day and noone seems to give a shit or make forum posts about.
[/quote]
rep++[/quote]

I saw a lot of people say things about soldiers and shit dieing everyday for their country. I’ll be honest… I’ll be more than happy to support those guys if they televise their deaths. Put cameras on the line of battle and stream it, i’ll watch it non stop.

The difference is that Paul Walker has been in everyones living room while the other 100,000 random people have never touched our lives ‘directly’. As a member of the audience I think it’s fair that I feel some loss. Not to mention he wasn’t the typical hollywood star. If you knew anything about him he only got reintroduced to acting when he wanted to pay off his student loans and has a large resume for giving back - ESPECIALLY with all the work he has done with marine biology in the southern cali area.

Now if there was a kim kardashian rip thread, you won’t see me anywhere near that shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul Walker dead in a car crash
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

[quote=“stewie0888, post:21, topic:536285”]I dont understand why people say things like “who cares many people die everyday so why is it a big deal when a famous persom dies?”

that’s like saying “why sould you care if your sister sister dies but not that guy who lives on the other side of town?” Its because you have some sort of connection with the person.

Millions of people saw his movies, his interviews, you saw him laugh, you saw him cry. It makes you feel like you know him a little. Thats why its a big deal.

If you dont care that he died, dont say anything about it.[/quote]

Famous or not, it shouldn’t matter. A human is human.

May he rest in peace.

Read full topic
item.source: Paul Walker dead in a car crash

Well… he’s the white man in Fast and Furious with Vin Disel, and the comments above explain it as well…

[/quote]

No the question implies ‘Who cares’, and ‘Why is this important enough to be news’. Peace to him however, and his family. I think it’d be better if such things were kept more private.[/quote]

When a person is famous nothing is private any more.

That’s bias. What’s a good movie?[/quote]It’s not biased. The series was drained completely out of creativity after the first couple films, but after the 6th+, it’s really nothing special at all.

He was a good actor. Anyway, RIP.
